title: Religiosity as the IDW's Final Frontier
description:
Religiosity has become the no-man's land between social and political adversaries. Robert Putnam demonstrates this in his book American Grace. The major cultural change in the United States is the segregation of the obviously religious from an imagined naked public space. 

Now while Sam Harris continues his crusade to banish religiosity Eric and Bret Weinstein among a host of others see the need to replace what religions provided for the masses. The condition, of course, is an imagined rationality that excludes what is commonly asserted as the supernatural. 

Much of what is being proposed to fill the place are pre-Christian religious or philosophical traditions with an unconscious Christian/humanist moral overlay. What happens to that overlay as the religious substrata continues to erode?
